meanings.definition: A strong, hard magnetic silvery-gray metal
meanings.sent1: The iron in the toolbox was heavy.
meanings.sent2: The iron bar was used to build the structure.
meanings.sent3: The iron block tried to stick to the magnet, but it kept slipping away.
meanings.sent4: Her will was as unyielding as iron when it came to her beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The iron sword gleamed in the sunlight, ready for battle.

meanings.definition: A tool or implement made of iron
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith forged a new iron for the farmer.
meanings.sent2: The iron hammer was perfect for driving in the nails.
meanings.sent3: The iron pot danced on the stove, bubbling with soup.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an iron, striking fear into his heart.
meanings.sent5: The iron key unlocked the ancient chest, revealing its treasures.

meanings.definition: To press clothes with a heated iron
meanings.sent1: She would iron her dress before the party.
meanings.sent2: He ironed his shirt to remove the wrinkles.
meanings.sent3: The iron glided smoothly over the fabric, making it crisp.
meanings.sent4: Her words ironed out the misunderstandings between them.
meanings.sent5: The sun seemed to iron out the wrinkles of the vast ocean.

meanings.definition: To make hard, stern, or unyielding
meanings.sent1: He tried to iron out his emotions before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher ironed out the rules for the class.
meanings.sent3: Her strict rules ironed out any chance of chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: The experience ironed his resolve to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range stood like an iron barrier against the storm.
